posts.post_content: So obviously this guy's gonna be in a red Battle cry deck. That being said, Battle cry decks are fast; [Memnite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Memnite)s, [Signal Pest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Signal Pest)s, [Goblin Bushwhacker](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Goblin Bushwhacker)s and [Kuldotha Rebirth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Kuldotha Rebirth)s abound. So the main weakness of this type o' deck? The fact that your creatures, while usually swingin' with a big amount of power, more often than not have one toughness. Even if they all get +3/+0, a few 1/1 Myr tokens can stop and kill them. That's where this guy comes in. Tough to burn before he gets his hit off thanks to Haste, this dude pops in and contemptuously brushes your opponent's defenses aside without a second glance, lettin' through all your 4/1 tokens to pummel him into submission. Worst case scenario for you, he has to sacrifice a bunch of relatively valuable creatures to stop them, since it's unlikely he'll have anything with enough toughness to survive blocking one of your guys. One of my favorite cards for this set. ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
So obviously this guy's gonna be in a red Battle cry deck. That being said, Battle cry decks are fast; Memnites, Signal Pests, Goblin Bushwhackers and Kuldotha Rebirths abound. So the main weakness of this type o' deck? The fact that your creatures, while usually swingin' with a big amount of power, more often than not have one toughness. Even if they all get +3/+0, a few 1/1 Myr tokens can stop and kill them. That's where this guy comes in. Tough to burn before he gets his hit off thanks to Haste, this dude pops in and contemptuously brushes your opponent's defenses aside without a second glance, lettin' through all your 4/1 tokens to pummel him into submission. Worst case scenario for you, he has to sacrifice a bunch of relatively valuable creatures to stop them, since it's unlikely he'll have anything with enough toughness to survive blocking one of your guys. One of my favorite cards for this set. ... (see all)

posts.post_content: I had 2 [Wall of Denial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wall of Denial)s, 1 [Wall of Frost](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Wall of Frost), 1 [Guard Gomazoa](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Guard Gomazoa), and 2 [Perimeter Captain](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Perimeter Captain)s out, along with [Leyline of Sanctity](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leyline of Sanctity) and a [Norn's Annex](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Norn's Annex). It was only a matter of time before my opponent decked himself. "Nothing can pass this defense!" I thought...until he played [Hero of the Oxid](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hero of the Oxid) Ridge and killed me. :(
posts.html:
I had 2 Wall of Denials, 1 Wall of Frost, 1 Guard Gomazoa, and 2 Perimeter Captains out, along with Leyline of Sanctity and a Norn's Annex. posts.post_content:
Where have all the good men gone  
and where are all the gods?  
Where's the streetwise Hercules to fight the rising odds?  
Isn't there a white knight upon a fiery steed?  
Late at night I toss  
and I turn  
and I dream of what I need.  
  
I need a hero  
I'm holding out for a hero 'til the end of the night  
He's gotta be strong  
And 's gotta be fast  
And he's gotta be fresh from the fight  
  
I need a hero  
I'm holding out for a hero 'til the morning light  
He's gotta be sure  
And it's gotta be soon  
And he's gotta be larger than life
